I used to use a neti pot regularly. One day I was a bit stuffy, so I flushed my sinus. I clogged one of my Eustachean tubes. I couldn't equalize pressure in that ear for a week.

When that ear finally popped, it felt better than an orgasm. But holy shit that was an uncomfortable week.

Never again.

reply_context.text: Neti pots are a lifesaver.

posts.text: by default turning on memory and inviting users to opt-out (rather than in) is an especially counter-productive pattern for these sorts of use cases where users are relying on predictable behavior.

reply_context.text: A major contributing factor to their struggle is lack of transparency wrt backend product modifications, resulting in previously useful system prompts no longer reliably producing assistive behaviors after an opaque update to an LLM product.
